unnormalised: New Delhi Faces Deteriorating Air Quality Post Diwali Celebrations
normalised: New Delhi Faces Deteriorating Air Quality Post Diwali Celebrations

unnormalised: New Delhi – Air quality in the National Capital Territory has plummeted to "Severe" levels in the days following the Diwali festival, according to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB). The Air Quality Index (AQI) crossed the 450 mark in several areas, including Anand Vihar and RK Puram.
normalised: New Delhi – Air quality in the National Capital Territory has plummeted to "Severe" levels in the days following the Diwali festival, according to the C P C B. The Air Quality Index (A Q I) crossed the four hundred and fifty mark in several areas, including Anand Vihar and R K Puram.

unnormalised: Experts attribute the spike to a combination of factors, including firecracker emissions, stubble burning in neighboring states like Haryana and Punjab, and meteorological conditions with low wind speed hindering dispersal. The CPCB has issued advisories recommending limiting outdoor activities, especially for vulnerable populations like children and the elderly.
